DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the present study is to prospectively evaluate whether performing an intra-uterine insemination 24 hours after the spontaneous LH peak may result in significantly higher ongoing pregnancy rates compared to 48 hours.
DOC.brief_title: Timing of Intrauterine Insemination (IUI) 24 or 48 Hours After Spontaneous Luteinizing Hormone (LH) Peak
DOC.criteria: below 39 years of age on the day of LH peak donor semen natural cycle (without CC) cycle with less than 3 follicles reaching 15 mm of diameter or more. with basal hormonal values of progesterone ( < 1,2 ng/dl) The patients excluded are women who underwent more than 6 intrauterine inseminations, with tubal infertility
